title: Mr. Hynde Is Out of His Mind
author: Dan Gutman

book_level.description: Elementary level - humorous school story about a fun music teacher

questions.question: What is the narrator's name?

options.A: A.J., the boy who hates school
options.B: Ryan, the sports-loving student
options.C: Michael, the quiet shy boy
options.D: Andrea, the smart class girl

questions.explanation: The narrator introduces himself as A.J. who hates school.

questions.question: What subject does A.J. hate the most?

options.A: Reading class with stories
options.B: Writing essays and reports
options.C: Math with lots of numbers
options.D: Music class with singing

questions.explanation: A.J. says music is the most boring subject in the history of the world.

questions.question: What is the name of the old music teacher?

options.A: Mr. Hind, the new guy
options.B: Mr. Loring, the boring one
options.C: Mr. Klutz, the principal
options.D: Miss Daisy, classroom teacher

questions.explanation: Mr. Loring is the old music teacher who taught boring songs.

questions.question: What is the new music teacher's name?

options.A: Mr. Loring who is retiring
options.B: Mr. Klutz the bald man
options.C: Mr. Hind who loves rap
options.D: Mr. Ryan the gym teacher

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind is the new music teacher who likes rap and hip-hop.

questions.question: Who is A.J.'s classroom teacher?

options.A: Miss Daisy who is nice
options.B: Andrea the smart girl
options.C: Emily the quiet friend
options.D: Mrs. Klutz at the office

questions.explanation: Miss Daisy is A.J.'s classroom teacher.

questions.question: Who does A.J. call a 'brown-noser'?

options.A: Ryan his best friend
options.B: Michael the quiet boy
options.C: Emily the shy girl
options.D: Andrea the perfect student

questions.explanation: A.J. calls Andrea a brown-noser because she loves school and always tries to impress teachers.

questions.question: Who are A.J.'s best friends?

options.A: Andrea and Emily together
options.B: Mr. Hind and Mr. Klutz
options.C: Ryan and Michael always
options.D: Miss Daisy and Andrea

questions.explanation: Ryan and Michael are A.J.'s best friends who agree with him about most things.

questions.question: What does A.J. want to be when he grows up?

options.A: A famous singer on stage
options.B: A dirt bike racer pro
options.C: A teacher like Mr. Hind
options.D: A rapper making music

questions.explanation: A.J. says when he grows up, he's going to be a professional dirt bike racer.

questions.question: Who is the school principal?

options.A: Mr. Loring the music man
options.B: Mr. Hind the rapper guy
options.C: Miss Daisy the nice lady
options.D: Mr. Klutz the bald one

questions.explanation: Mr. Klutz is the school principal who is completely bald.

questions.question: What kind of music does Mr. Hind like?

options.A: Rap and hip-hop beats
options.B: Classical piano music
options.C: Country guitar songs
options.D: Opera singing loudly

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind loves rap and hip-hop music and teaches the kids about it.

questions.question: What instrument does Andrea play?

options.A: Drums with drumsticks
options.B: Guitar with six strings
options.C: Piano and also violin
options.D: Flute made of metal

questions.explanation: Andrea takes piano lessons and violin lessons.

questions.question: What event is announced at the beginning of the story?

options.A: Summer vacation is coming
options.B: Christmas break is here
options.C: Music festival at school
options.D: TV Turn-Off Month now

questions.explanation: TV Turn-Off Week became TV Turn-Off Month - four weeks without TV.

questions.question: What play do the students perform?

options.A: The Princess and Pea
options.B: Cinderella at the ball
options.C: Snow White and dwarfs
options.D: Beauty and the Beast

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind has them put on a hip-hop version of Beauty and the Beast.

questions.question: Who plays Beauty in the play?

options.A: Emily the quiet one
options.B: Andrea the smart girl
options.C: A.J. the main narrator
options.D: Miss Daisy the teacher

questions.explanation: Andrea is chosen to be Beauty in the play.

questions.question: Who plays the Beast in the play?

options.A: A.J. who volunteered quick
options.B: Ryan who loves football
options.C: Michael the shy student
options.D: Mr. Hind the teacher

questions.explanation: A.J. volunteers to be the Beast when he hears he can torture Beauty.

questions.question: What does Mr. Hind wear when he first appears?

options.A: A suit with a nice tie
options.B: A tuxedo black and white
options.C: Regular everyday clothes
options.D: Purple cape with sequins

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind wears a purple cape with sequins, sunglasses, and a baseball cap.

questions.question: What is Mr. Klutz's most noticeable feature?

options.A: He is very tall
options.B: He has a long beard
options.C: He wears big glasses
options.D: He is completely bald

questions.explanation: Mr. Klutz is completely bald with no hair at all on his head.

questions.question: What subject does Mr. Hind teach about with rulers?

options.A: Math with measuring stuff
options.B: Reading lines in books
options.C: Percussion hitting things
options.D: Dance moving your feet

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind uses rulers to hit objects and teach about percussion.

questions.question: What does A.J. call the cafeteria?

options.A: The lunchroom for eating
options.B: The eating hall for food
options.C: The food court at school
options.D: The vomitorium always

questions.explanation: A.J. calls the cafeteria the 'vomitorium.'

questions.question: What does Mr. Hind want to become someday?

options.A: Principal of the school
options.B: Classical music player
options.C: A famous rapper star
options.D: A TV show celebrity

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind is working on his own CD and hopes to become a famous rapper.

questions.question: A.J. didn't like Mr. Loring's music class because...

options.A: they had to sing the same boring old songs over and over again
options.B: Mr. Loring was very mean and yelled at students all the time
options.C: there was way too much homework to do every single night
options.D: the music room was always too cold and uncomfortable to sit in

questions.explanation: Mr. Loring made them sing songs like 'Who Stole the Cookie from the Cookie Jar' so many times that A.J. never wanted to eat cookies again.

questions.question: When Mr. Hind first entered the classroom, there was...

options.A: complete silence with everyone sitting still and waiting quietly
options.B: classical music playing softly from the old record player
options.C: students already singing the boring songs from before
options.D: purple smoke, laser beams, and loud drum music everywhere

questions.explanation: Purple smoke, laser beams, and drum beats from a boombox created a dramatic entrance for Mr. Hind.

questions.question: Andrea wanted to get Mr. Hind fired because...

options.A: he was really mean to her and made her cry in class
options.B: she thought he was incompetent and didn't teach real music
options.C: he gave way too much homework for students to handle
options.D: he yelled at her in front of everyone in the classroom

questions.explanation: Andrea said Mr. Hind was 'incompetent' because he didn't play traditional instruments or teach about classical composers.

questions.question: When Mr. Klutz walked in on Mr. Hind's noisy lesson, he...

options.A: fired Mr. Hind right away and told him to leave school
options.B: told everyone to be quiet and sit down immediately
options.C: started rapping and said that Mr. Hind was really cool
options.D: left the room without saying a single word to anyone

questions.explanation: Mr. Klutz surprised everyone by rapping and saying 'I rule the school, and I say Mr. Hind is cool.'

questions.question: Mr. Hind played Mr. Klutz's bald head like...

options.A: a piano by tapping different notes with his fingers
options.B: a drum by hitting it hard with two wooden sticks
options.C: a bongo by drumming the top of his shiny head
options.D: a guitar by strumming across his smooth scalp

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind started drumming the top of Principal Klutz's bald head like it was a bongo.

questions.question: A.J. volunteered to be the Beast because...

options.A: he really liked acting and wanted to be on stage
options.B: Andrea asked him nicely to be her partner in play
options.C: no one else in the class wanted to take the role
options.D: he heard the Beast gets to torture Beauty in dungeon

questions.explanation: When Mr. Hind said 'the Beast gets to lock Beauty in the dungeon and torture her,' A.J. immediately volunteered.

questions.question: A.J. didn't want to kiss Andrea in the play, so Mr. Hind told him to...

options.A: just skip that part and pretend it happened off stage
options.B: pretend she was something he liked, like a dirt bike
options.C: have someone else take over the Beast role instead
options.D: close his eyes tight and think of absolutely nothing

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind said to pretend Andrea was a dirt bike, just like he pretended green beans were oatmeal cookies when he was young.

questions.question: Andrea said she would pretend A.J. was...

options.A: a football because she liked sports a lot
options.B: a dirt bike because A.J. mentioned it first
options.C: an encyclopedia because she loved reading books
options.D: a piano because she played music every day

questions.explanation: Andrea said she would pretend A.J. was an encyclopedia during the kiss scene.

questions.question: A.J.'s rule about Andrea is that...

options.A: he agrees with everything Andrea says in class
options.B: anything she likes, he doesn't like, and vice versa
options.C: they are actually best friends who pretend fight
options.D: he ignores her completely and never talks to her

questions.explanation: A.J. says 'Anything Andrea doesn't like, I like. And anything Andrea likes, I don't like.'

questions.question: Mr. Hind taught that percussion is...

options.A: saying bad words that you shouldn't say out loud
options.B: when one object hits against another object hard
options.C: a special type of singing that uses your throat
options.D: playing piano with your fingers on white keys

questions.explanation: Andrea correctly defined percussion as 'when one object hits against another object.'

questions.question: During the percussion lesson, Mr. Hind put a garbage can on his foot and...

options.A: fell over and everyone laughed at him really hard
options.B: sat down because it was too heavy for him
options.C: threw it away into the corner of the room
options.D: tap danced while drumming on things with rulers

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind tap danced with a garbage can on his foot while hitting things with rulers.

questions.question: A.J. was confused about multiplication because...

options.A: he didn't do his math homework the night before
options.B: 2+2 and 2x2 both equal 4, which made no sense
options.C: the teacher didn't explain multiplication clearly enough
options.D: he just didn't like numbers and refused to learn

questions.explanation: A.J. couldn't understand how addition and multiplication could give the same answer for 2+2 and 2x2.

questions.question: A.J. calls Andrea 'goody two-shoes' because...

options.A: she wears really nice expensive shoes to school
options.B: she loves everything about school and tries to be perfect
options.C: she is really good at playing sports with everyone
options.D: she owns two pairs of the exact same shoes

questions.explanation: Andrea loves school, homework, and always tries to impress teachers, which A.J. finds annoying.

questions.question: Ryan said he would kiss a football because...

options.A: he was just joking around with his friends
options.B: A.J. told him that's what he should do
options.C: that's what he really liked more than anything
options.D: it was an actual part of the school play

questions.explanation: When A.J. said he'd pretend Andrea was a dirt bike, Ryan said he'd kiss a football because that's what he likes.

questions.question: TV Turn-Off Month was even worse than A.J. expected because...

options.A: it was only supposed to be one short week
options.B: it lasted four whole weeks instead of just one
options.C: there was extra homework on top of no TV
options.D: he also had to read many boring books too

questions.explanation: TV Turn-Off Week had been so 'successful' that they made it TV Turn-Off Month - four weeks.

questions.question: Mr. Hind introduced himself as...

options.A: a regular boring teacher just like all the others
options.B: Jam Master Hind, the one-man funky groove machine
options.C: a classical musician who plays piano and violin
options.D: the new principal who would run the whole school

questions.explanation: Two assistants announced him as 'Jam Master Hind, the one-man funky groove machine.'

questions.question: A.J. doesn't want to be in the play after learning he has to...

options.A: memorize way too many difficult lines for the show
options.B: wear an ugly embarrassing costume on the stage
options.C: dance in front of everyone watching in audience
options.D: kiss Andrea at the very end of the whole play

questions.explanation: A.J. is horrified when Michael shows him the script says 'Beauty and the Beast kiss.'

questions.question: When A.J. asks Andrea if she can 'sing solo,' his joke is...

options.A: that she should sing alone without anyone else
options.B: that she should sing so low that no one hears
options.C: that solo is another word for being very quiet
options.D: that she's actually a really good talented singer

questions.explanation: A.J.'s joke is 'sing solo' meaning 'so low' that no one can hear her.

questions.question: The play is a 'hip-hop' version which means...

options.A: it's exactly the same as the original fairy tale
options.B: Mr. Hind adds rap and modern music to it
options.C: there's absolutely no music in it at all
options.D: only classical orchestra music is ever used

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind makes everything hip-hop style, including the school play.

questions.question: Andrea's mother is the PTA vice president, which is important because...

options.A: she can give Andrea lots of extra homework
options.B: she chooses which school plays get performed
options.C: she runs the school cafeteria every day
options.D: if enough parents complain, teachers get fired

questions.explanation: Andrea threatens to have her mother complain to get Mr. Hind fired.

questions.question: Why does A.J. start liking rap music after meeting Mr. Hind?

options.A: Because the rap music is actually really good quality
options.B: Because Andrea hates it, and he likes what she hates
options.C: Because all of his friends started liking it too
options.D: Because his parents told him he should enjoy it

questions.explanation: A.J. admits he 'didn't even like rap music very much, but I think I'm gonna like it now that I know Andrea hates it.'

questions.question: What does the story suggest about different styles of teaching?

options.A: Only traditional boring teaching methods actually work
options.B: Teachers should never try to be creative with lessons
options.C: Engaging fun methods can make boring subjects exciting
options.D: Students will always hate every single music class

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind's energetic, unconventional methods make music class exciting for students who hated Mr. Loring's boring approach.

questions.question: What does Mr. Klutz's reaction to Mr. Hind's teaching style reveal?

options.A: Good leaders support teachers who connect with students well
options.B: Principals always hate when teachers have too much fun
options.C: Bald people really enjoy listening to music a lot
options.D: Principals are never able to rap or dance at all

questions.explanation: Mr. Klutz supports Mr. Hind by rapping and saying he's cool, showing good leadership means backing effective teachers.

questions.question: Why is it ironic that A.J. ends up enjoying music class?

options.A: Because he has always loved music since he was young
options.B: Because he claimed music was most boring but now likes it
options.C: Because Andrea was the one who actually taught him
options.D: Because his parents forced him to enjoy music class

questions.explanation: A.J. started the story saying he hated music most of all, but Mr. Hind's methods changed his mind.

questions.question: What does Mr. Hind's green beans story teach about overcoming challenges?

options.A: You should never eat any vegetables at all
options.B: Parents are always wrong about healthy food choices
options.C: You can make hard things easier by changing your thinking
options.D: You should only eat foods that you already like

questions.explanation: By pretending green beans were oatmeal cookies, young Mr. Hind made them easier to eat - similar to A.J. pretending Andrea is a dirt bike.

questions.question: What theme does the rivalry between A.J. and Andrea represent?

options.A: Boys are always much smarter than girls in school
options.B: Different personalities can clash but still work together
options.C: School is always boring and nobody should enjoy it
options.D: Teachers always play favorites with certain students

questions.explanation: Despite constantly disagreeing, A.J. and Andrea end up working together in the play, showing opposites can collaborate.

questions.question: Why might the author have made TV Turn-Off Month happen during this story?

options.A: To punish all the kids for watching too much TV
options.B: To show music and creativity can fill the entertainment gap
options.C: To make all the parents in the story very happy
options.D: There was no particular reason for including it

questions.explanation: With no TV, the kids have to find other entertainment - and music class with Mr. Hind becomes better than TV.

questions.question: What does Andrea's complaint that Mr. Hind 'doesn't play any musical instruments' reveal about her thinking?

options.A: She is always completely right about everything
options.B: Turntables and DJing are definitely not real instruments
options.C: She has a narrow definition of what real music is
options.D: Every teacher must know how to play the piano

questions.explanation: Andrea dismisses hip-hop and DJing as 'not real music,' showing she has a limited view of what music can be.

questions.question: What is the significance of both A.J. and Andrea going to Mr. Hind about not wanting to kiss each other?

options.A: They both completely hate being in the school play
options.B: Despite being opposites, they share the same fear about kiss
options.C: They both want to quit school and never come back
options.D: They actually secretly like each other very much

questions.explanation: This shows that even people who seem completely different can have the same worries and insecurities.

questions.question: Why is Mr. Hind described as 'out of his mind' in the title?

options.A: He is actually crazy and needs medical help now
options.B: His wild teaching style seems crazy but is effective
options.C: He always forgets his lessons and what to teach
options.D: He cannot teach students anything at all ever

questions.explanation: His wild entrances, rap music, and dancing seem 'crazy' compared to traditional teaching, but it's effective.

questions.question: What does A.J.'s exaggeration 'the most boring subject in the history of the world' tell us about his character?

options.A: He is a historian who studies world history
options.B: He uses dramatic language and humor to express himself
options.C: He knows everything about all of history already
options.D: He is always serious and never jokes around ever

questions.explanation: A.J. constantly uses hyperbole like 'in the history of the world' for humor and to emphasize his feelings.

questions.question: What is ironic about Andrea wanting Mr. Hind fired?

options.A: She actually loves all teachers no matter what
options.B: She claims to love music but rejects the exciting teacher
options.C: She is the very best singer in the whole class
options.D: Teachers can never be fired from their jobs ever

questions.explanation: Andrea says she loves music, but she tries to fire the teacher who finally makes music class exciting for everyone else.

questions.question: What does the story suggest about the definition of 'music'?

options.A: Music can include rap, percussion, and DJ scratching
options.B: Only classical music with instruments counts as real
options.C: Music must always be slow and boring to be real
options.D: Only singing with your voice is considered music

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind shows that percussion, rap, and turntable scratching are all valid forms of music.

questions.question: Why might A.J. keep telling jokes even when no one laughs?

options.A: He doesn't realize that his jokes are actually bad
options.B: He enjoys jokes and believes someone will eventually laugh
options.C: All of his friends always tell him to keep joking
options.D: His teachers require him to tell jokes in class

questions.explanation: A.J. says he'll 'keep telling that joke until somebody laughs,' showing persistence and self-confidence.

questions.question: What does the contrast between Mr. Loring and Mr. Hind represent?

options.A: Old teachers are always bad and young ones good
options.B: Different teaching styles have very different effects on kids
options.C: Only young teachers can ever be good at teaching
options.D: Music as a subject never changes over time ever

questions.explanation: The old, traditional Mr. Loring bored students while the young, modern Mr. Hind engages them, showing how approach matters.

questions.question: What lesson does Mr. Hind's advice about kissing teach?

options.A: You should never kiss anyone at all ever
options.B: Only kiss dirt bikes and footballs not people
options.C: Things you don't want to do now might seem different later
options.D: You should avoid being in all school plays

questions.explanation: Mr. Hind says 'someday you're gonna wanna kiss girls' and to take chances now because opportunities may not come later.

questions.question: What does A.J.'s comment 'I used to like that song' about the cookie jar song reveal?

options.A: He never actually liked any songs at all ever
options.B: Repetition can ruin something you once really enjoyed
options.C: Cookies are bad and you should not eat them
options.D: All songs are always boring no matter what

questions.explanation: Too much repetition made A.J. hate a song he once liked, showing how overdoing things can backfire.

questions.question: Why is it significant that Emily 'always agrees with Andrea'?

options.A: Emily and Andrea are actually twin sisters
options.B: The teachers told them to always agree together
options.C: It shows Emily lacks independent thinking of her own
options.D: Emily and Andrea are sisters who live together

questions.explanation: A.J. finds Emily annoying because 'Emily agrees with everything Andrea says,' showing she doesn't think for herself.

questions.question: What does A.J. mean when he says music class with Mr. Hind is 'better than TV'?

options.A: He completely hates watching TV shows now
options.B: Something he thought was boring became more fun than TV
options.C: The television at his house is broken now
options.D: Mr. Hind has a television in the music room

questions.explanation: A.J. loves TV and hated music, so saying music class is better than TV shows how much Mr. Hind changed his view.

questions.question: What is the overall message of Mr. Hynde Is Out of His Mind?

options.A: School should always be boring and serious
options.B: Music is only for talented people who practice
options.C: Passionate creative teaching can make any subject exciting
options.D: Rules should never be broken by anyone ever

questions.explanation: The book shows that an enthusiastic, unconventional teacher can transform a hated subject into something students love.
